chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Guttke Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

03:01 PM Defendant Steven D Guttke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF78, 16CF23
Counsel have received the PSI and are prepared to proceed today.  State has complied with victim notification rights.  
Atty Juech makes sentencing statement and agrees with a stayed prison sentence with probation.  Requests some conditional jail time.  Atty Frank makes sentencing statement but believes a withheld sentence would be appropriate.  Defendant makes statement.  

BY THE COURT: 
15CF78 - Ct 1:  Court will withhold sentence and place defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Submission of a DNA Sample
-Payment costs of $518.00
-Serve 90 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  May be served in Dane County.  Sentence to commence within 60 days.
-Comply with any recommendations by the agent

16CF23 - Ct 1:  Court will withhold sentence and place defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Pay costs of $518.00
-Submit DNA sample
-Comply with any recommendation by the agent

15CF78, 16CF23
Atty Frank states there is a request for a PSI.  Atty Burdon agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will order a PSI on each case and set for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on March 24, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

03:04 PM Defendant Steven D Guttke appeared by video means with Attorney Ryan T. Frank. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
15CF78, 16CF23
Court questions defendant who has no objection to handling this hearing by zoom.  Court reviews DPA.  Court notes the previous extension of the DPA does not show in 16CF23 and the DA is to get that filed.  Atty Juech states motion to terminate the DPA in 15CF78.  Atty Frank responds.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants motion to revoke in 15CF78.  
Atty Juech believes both cases were to previously be extended but the document was filed with only the 15CF78 case.  Atty Frank responds.  
BY THE COURT:  On the 16CF23, Court will grant the motion to revoke; however, Atty Frank will have 30 days to show the Court why it should not be extended.  State will have 30 days to respond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2021 at 01:00 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Reset motion  Motion hearing scheduled for November 17, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Set for further hearing  Motion hearing scheduled for October 13, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Deferred Prosecution Agreement s/BNB/12-7-16

Defendant Steven D Guttke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1, 2 & 3 in 15CF78 & Ct. 1 in 16CF23, Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 36 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF78 & Ct. 1 in 16CF23.  
Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3 in 15CF78 and approve and signs the 36 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF78 & Ct. 1 in 16CF23.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed in 16CF23.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 15CF78 & Ct. 1 in 16CF23:  Court approves and signs the 36 month DPA with conditions.

15CF78:  Counts 2 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber as conditional time on Ct. 2.
  Report on or before December 16, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Court Costs = $243.00 x 2 (on each count)
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $200.00 x 2 (on each count)
Bonds in both cases to be applied.

Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed in 16CF23.

Final pre-trial on October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven D Guttke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is not yet resolved and leaves the scheduling to Atty Frank.  Atty Frank asks for a trial date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
